data.name: Number of Numbers
data.description:
In this kata you will be given two integer parameters `k` and `n` into a function `repeat` and you have to return a number in which k occurs n times. However the twist in this kata is that the builtin function `str()` is disabled. So you will have to figure a solution without using it.

``` python
repeat(1,3) → 111
repeat(5,5) → 55555
repeat(123,4) → 123123123123
```

# Note:
- The maximum value of k will be 10000 while the maximum value of n will be 100
- Anybody solving this Kata in beta, please solve this kata without using the `str()` function and if you know how to disable the `str()` function, please edit the kata and disable it. I searched everywhere and could not find how to do it. I would be really grateful if you could do it :)
